a developer, when choosing a chain to use, would have to weight the modularity of consensus level changes when spawning a komodo assets chain with another PoS chain generator with less tweakable parameters and a mature multi devloper ecosystem that he could use after the chain has spawn

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
Anyway, u can try assetchains params to create a PoS blockchain. 
Then check existing crypto-conditions documentation and many reference code,
Then make a CC for your own PoS assetchain. 

All with a cost of 0 KMD.
If desired can go with dPoW with your choice or not.

Content: If ur blockchain project goes big, can scale it too, with MoMoM tech. Already tested last year.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I'm having the feeling you are rushing to take decision. If so, do not do so. Give your own self time to read, analyze different possible solutions for a problem.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: If don't like komodo, don't go with it. Go with the solution u liked. Maybe possible you get success out of it.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Just read all you possibly can about komodo.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Also share what you didn't like about komodo. We'd love to hear where it didn't meet dev's needs.

Author: artik123#2884
Content:
Let me ask it this way. do you think that any guy with a killer app would certainly use the komodo route? and also what could define the guy that does choose the komodo route?
low development costs, scarce of resources like time and money?
for example for someone to create his own chain from scratch would be the longest route and the most time, money consuming...
but at-least 100 projects went this route... so how would you define the guy that chooses komodo?

Author: artik123#2884
Content: in other words.. who are your customers?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
I guess you need to first define that "Guy". I just assume that, that guy is a developer, a developer who can code in languages which are complied to  native code, instead of bytecode, for now. If so, the finest route is the same I expressed in steps earlier in my comments. 

If a Javascript dev, better wait for @Deleted User to finish his work, then that too will be possible soon enough.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Also read. Without reading the written material you are missing a lot of knowledge and wisdom about komodo.

Author: artik123#2884

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
Komodo is NOT a smart contracts platform. 
It is in my opinion Smart Custom Consensus Platform

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Where developers create Custom consensus.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Or just use existing custom consensus RPC API calls to make applications on top of it.

Author: artik123#2884
Content: this is a definition of the tech... not the customer...

Content: I can not answer that guy question. Just pick the examples from existing world and history for such guys.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: I think the WP comparison works really well for the fork vs. assetchain discussion. A developer with a great website idea can code the php from scratch but won‚Äôt be able to take advantage of the tons of plugins already built for the WP framework, similar situation with Komodo and its CC,  you *could* custom code functionality into your chain, or take advantage of the dozens of already coded and tested modules.  Since time= money ,  just like with WordPress you save a lot of both.  This is especially important for people don‚Äôt have lots of money or dev experience  to be able to work on a project.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @artik123   Governance can be done with consensus level changes,  cc payments is a good example of governance functionality  through consensus.

Author: artik123#2884
Content: this is a start

Author: artik123#2884
Content: same for voting?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Yes I am sure that could be done as well,  though currently we don‚Äôt have a voting CC.   CC is very powerful in that you can pretty much make anything abide by consensus

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Governance is something that people I assume want enforced so  there needs to be a mechanism to enforce it
